financial.title: Financial Metrics
financial.description: Key financial metrics and performance indicators

financial.exportErrorDesc: There was an error exporting the financial data.
financial.reportGeneratingDesc: Your financial report is being generated.
financial.reportReadyDesc: Your financial report is ready to download.

capRateInfo.title: Capitalization Rate
capRateInfo.description: The cap rate is the ratio between the net operating income (NOI) of a property and its current market value or acquisition cost.
capRateInfo.benchmark: Benchmark: Higher is better. 5-7% is average, >8% is excellent.

operatingExpenseRatioInfo.title: Operating Expense Ratio
operatingExpenseRatioInfo.description: The operating expense ratio measures the cost to operate a property compared to the income it generates.
operatingExpenseRatioInfo.formula: Formula: Operating Expenses ÷ Gross Operating Income
operatingExpenseRatioInfo.benchmark: Benchmark: Lower is better. 35-45% is typical for residential, 30-40% for commercial.

dscRatioInfo.title: Debt Service Coverage Ratio
dscRatioInfo.description: DSCR measures the property's ability to cover its debt obligations with its operating income.
dscRatioInfo.benchmark: Benchmark: Higher is better. >1.25 is generally required by lenders, >1.5 is strong.

cashOnCashInfo.title: Cash on Cash Return
cashOnCashInfo.description: Cash on cash return measures the annual return on the cash invested in a property.
cashOnCashInfo.formula: Formula: Annual Pre-Tax Cash Flow ÷ Total Cash Invested
cashOnCashInfo.benchmark: Benchmark: Higher is better. 6-8% is considered good, >10% is excellent.

grmInfo.title: Gross Rent Multiplier
grmInfo.description: GRM is the ratio of a property's price to its gross rental income.
grmInfo.formula: Formula: Property Price ÷ Annual Gross Rental Income
grmInfo.benchmark: Benchmark: Lower generally indicates better value. 8-12 is typical.

breakEvenInfo.title: Break Even Ratio
breakEvenInfo.description: The break even ratio indicates how much of the gross operating income is used to cover debt service and operating expenses.
breakEvenInfo.formula: Formula: (Operating Expenses + Debt Service) ÷ Gross Operating Income
breakEvenInfo.benchmark: Benchmark: Lower is better. <85% is generally considered good.
